abstract: Edward E. Whitacre Jr., the former head of AT&T who built the company into a telephone giant through a series of mergers, has been chosen to be chairman of the new, slimmed-down version of General Motors when it emerges from bankruptcy protection.
snippet: Edward E. Whitacre Jr., the former head of AT&T who built the company into a telephone giant through a series of mergers, has been chosen to be chairman of the new, slimmed-down version of General Motors when it emerges from bankruptcy protection.
lead_paragraph: Edward E. Whitacre Jr., the former head of AT&T who built the company into a telephone giant through a series of mergers, has been chosen to be chairman of the new, slimmed-down version of General Motors when it emerges from bankruptcy protection.

headline.main: Former AT&T Chief to Be G.M.’s New Chairman
